intro: Sclerorhachis platyrachis, commonly known as the broad-rachis fern, is a member of the family Osmundaceae. It is characterized by its large, robust fronds that can reach several meters in length. The plant has a thick, fleshy rhizome that helps it store water and nutrients. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with numerous pinnae arranged in a distinctive, fan-like pattern. This fern is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps.
